comments.body: Please go into more detail about how this would work
With a new GUI, a button can appear in the inventory when another player is enough close to propose the securised trade.
I dig it!

There is a mod, called – simply – Trade. It's a quick and good implementation of trading of players.

Another way can be as Custom NPCs mod works, there is a trading block in it.
I would prefer a trading block. Then you could create shops markets. Servers should allow admin to modify owner (because most spawns are locked)

I think that it should be like there are a few slots in the inventory, that the owner of the block can place the items they would like to sell. Then they place items in slots corresponding to that one for the customers then to have to place se items in for payment haha
Or maybe make it possible to drop items in camp so your friend can pick it up

Making a UI popup button the same for when trading with villagers would definitely be beneficial. Players could walk up to one another individually and be given the option to trade with what they have inside their inventory, instead of throwing their items on the ground. This would prevent players from defrauding each other by ensuring they receive what they bargained for. Both players would have to propose an offer and agree with a trade to complete a transaction. Sure, it would be possible to accomplish this by having a trading block, but that might bring the opportunity for all players in a multiplayer world to trade instantaneously. This might discourage people away from playing normally (via getting the materials yourself) more often. If not, then I don’t see the point in requiring players to craft a specific block just to trade. That adds an extra step for trading that should already be available from the get-go reliably.
That's a really good idea, but there should be a gamerule that enables trading with players.

I think this idea is LONG overdue. 1.14 broke up the paintings into individual textures and has even added animation!

In addition to this idea, I'd like to see this coded for people to load their own named painting textures for future Texture/Resource packs.
Can we please have this amazing idea? I was actually getting on to create a feedback post for this and searched first, so thank you.

I would like to see a bigger selection of paintings in the regular game. art and furniture fronts would be great. I've built some giant structures castle being one of them and there's not enough painting selections to fill it.

I was just about to post exactly this. I'm making an art gallery in my world and not only is it super frustrating to get the paintings you want but also there's only a small number of paintings so any sort of museum type structure you want to make is limited to how big you can actually make it without repeats. if the paintings are easily selectable then they could add as many new paintings as they want, they could take the painting sets from all the best texture packs ever made and add them with no worry of making the player's life more difficult. I'd also love the ability to upload custom paintings to the game, including PNG and GIF files. it's currently possible to make custom "paintings" by overwriting maps using special programs but that's impossible on servers and realms, I also don't want to just change the texture pack I'm using, it'd suck if I put a custom painting up in my house that really fits the theme of my build but everyone else on the server only sees like a Creeper or something and it actually clashes with the decor.

I want custom paintings on realms and servers that people can actually see. also add HD player skins so I can make myself more fancy.
I like it but i want the menu to be more Minecraft-style
Definitely need this! It's such a pain trying to find a painting!

Are you tired of placing/breaking paintings until you finally get the exact painting you want? Well I’ve got the solution for you! The easel could be crafted using six sticks in the shape of an easel. 

The painting item will be renamed to canvas. After placing a canvas on the easel, you could click/tap the canvas to see all the different paintings. Each painting would require three dyes of three different colors. For example, the creeper painting would need blue, light blue, and lime.

It would also be amazing if there were a lot more paintings. I especially want more 2x1 block paintings like the creeper one and larger paintings.

Paintings

  • Snowy Mountain (2x1 blocks) 32x16
  • Cherry Blossom and a snowy mountain (4x2 blocks) 64x32
  • Copper golem (4x2 blocks) 64x32
  • Axolotl (4x2 blocks) 64x32
  • Creaking in the Pale Gardens (4x2 blocks) 64x32
  • Pirate Ship (4x2 blocks) 64x32
  • Panda eating bamboo (4x2 blocks) 64x32
  • Army of frogs (4x3 blocks) 64x48
  • Allay dance party (4x3 blocks) 64x48
  • Ender Dragon (4x3 blocks) 64x48

 

Feel free to make any more painting ideas.

I've been longing for this feature to be implemented into the Bedrock version for so long now - the ability to assign items in the inventory to the 1-9 hotbar slots, makes navigating the inventory way faster, as you don't have to move the mouse over to the item to then drag it over. Dunno if I'm being lazy or impatient wanting this feature, but I'm used to it from most time spent in Java version. It wasn't long ago it became worth moving over to Bedrock
YES YES YES absolutely needed. It already moves it while pressing F in-hand, why not move it while hovering??

I would rather use the 0 key.

It makes more sense because you are already using 1-9 for hotbar, and the offhand is on the left where a 0 would be anyway. 

 

I think barely anyone uses the numbers anyway so this will probably never get traction :(
They should also make it so you can put any item in offhand like in java, it would be very nice quality of life

You can import the world from the Realm in Bedrock so you can see your coordinates.

(continued)
How I imagine this mechanic:

- (insert item to new position) Dragging an item to the space between two horizontally adjacent item slots, would show an "insertion" caret between the target slots, and when releasing the drag, the dragged item would take up the position of the second target and move all following slots one slot along on that tab, including the target

- (insert item to beginning of row) Dragging an item to the space left of the first item slot of a row, would show an "insertion" caret left of that slot, and when releasing the drag, the dragged item would take up the position of the first slot of the row and move all following slots along on that tab, including the target

- (swapping item position) Dragging an item on top of an existing item slot (as opposed to between slots), and releasing, would swap the two item slots without changing any other slot's positions

- Dragging an item on top of a tab button before releasing, would temporarily change that tab's icon to signal which tab is going to be affected

- (customize tab icon) Dragging an item on top of the current tab button and releasing, would customize the tab's icon to that of the dragged item

- (move item to different tab) Dragging an item on top of the tab button of another tab and releasing, would move the item to the end of that tab, without switching to that tab (so multiple items can be moved to it)

(continued) 
- (create new tab with starter item) Dragging an item to the space between existing tab buttons, before releasing, would temporarilly show an "insertion" icon between those tabs to signal where a new tab would be created. Upon releasing the drag, a new tab would be created there with its icon set to the dragged item, and tooltip to "New Tab" for instance, and the following tabs shifted around to make room for it.

- (create new empty tab) Alternatively a new tab could also be created by clicking a "New Tab" tab button or dragging an item onto one, but the new tab would need to be moved separately that way as the button to make an empty tab can only be in a fixed position at this point. the new tab also can't have a starter icon this way

- (reorder tabs) Dragging a tab button before releasing, would temporarily show a "move" caret between the target tabs, similar to dragging items between other item slots, to signal where the dragged tab should go, and upon releasing the drag, the tab would be inserted to its new position

- (rename tab) Each tab would also have a small editable textfield between the tab button and slots area, which contains the tooltip of that tab, for customizing the tab's tooltip

- (reset layout) When customizations have already been saved, a "reset" button would appear, to allow for reverting all customizations of the whole creative inventory, after a warning message

(continued)
How to save the data:

The best way to save the custom "creative layout" data would be in a JSON file (or similar) in the player's current game folder, next to the "hotbar.nbt" file. This would enable players to automatically keep the same layout between different worlds. And if the data is saved to its own file, it would allow custom creative layouts to also (manually) be moved or copied to other game folders (and thus profiles), similar to data and resource packs. But the file should not be saved directly in a world folder, as it could be invasive to the user to have to copy their favourite (possibly effort intensive) creative layout between every world they want to play in.

By default when there are no customizations made yet, the file automatically gets generated with the current game-default layout when needed. Not sure exactly "when", due to limited technical insight, but if not performance incurring, preferrably when the first customization is made.
My Idea is that the Wither and Ender Dragon Spawn Eggs are only in the Creative Inventory if you are a Operator.

I really like this idea! However, I think it can be improved. Console players can do this easily with their controllers but IOS/Android players have a touch screen that makes it far more difficult to do this unless you go into Settings. I want to add something to this.

The Setting to change your POV can still be there, but right under it there should be an on/off feature to adjust whether or not you want a POV button. This would make it less annoying for people who don’t want to use this feature and convenient for those who do!

I really do love this idea, but perhaps more can be added to it! Feel free to discuss any questions or what’s on your mind if you would like!

Hey! Please note that links and/or images are not currently allowed and was deleted from your post. Don't forget you can share your ideas that require images, on our Discord and/or on reddit's r/minecraftsuggestions sub! The No Image/Links rule for this site is only temporary!

I agree with this suggestion, as I personally feel very excluded, seeing all of my friends running around with capes and not me!

I have been playing Minecraft for 10+ years and I've seen the game's gradual burst into popularity. I watched that all fizzle out in 2016, for it to soar back into popularity in 2019 and beyond.

This is why I feel like it's a slap in the face for me, growing up with legacy console and bedrock, only being able to buy the java edition in early 2021 due to not being to afford a suitable PC for most of my life.

I hope they add a cape for people in my situation, as I also feel left out because I have been playing Minecraft significantly longer than most of my entire friend group, so for me, who is the only one without a cape feels wrong.

I bought the game fairly recently, but before the migration started.
I work in IT and am well aware of what a humongous pain it is to migrate user accounts, so when presented with the option between mojang or microsoft account, I chose MS, if only not to have those likely migration issues.

It saddens me to see that people who informed themselves and actively try to avoid problems, both for MS/MJ as for themselves, don't get the same perks as people who don't care about if it works until it suddenly doesn't anymore, despite the announcement of the change being more than a year earlier and with a notification on their launcher every time they open Minecraft.

I hope this isn't a sign of what the future will bring...

A raw mouse input setting for Bedrock Edition would be really nice. I prefer having the "enhance pointer precision" setting enabled, but this also affects camera sensitivity in Minecraft, which I do not want. A setting to force raw mouse input would be nice for this.

 

As for Java Edition, I believe mouse acceleration was temporarily present as a bug in 1.14.3. It has since been fixed, but I guess a setting would be nice as well for people that want mouse acceleration to affect the camera.

This needs to happen. It would be especially helpful for those building communities and that are capable of running their own dedicated servers. Having to leave a device logged into a world 24/7 just so others can join is not practical, because it pauses the world and does not allow others to join if the host has the game paused or running in the background. Playing your own world offers 8 player slots, and a realm only offers 10, so paying for a realm is not plausible at the extra cost. Especially when a dedicated server on a really good internet connection could easily handle 20+ players at one time.

PC users have a button in the Servers tab to "Add Server", and it should be present on all devices/consoles. This suggestion is three years old at this point and is becoming more and more relevant for many players in this era, but not enough people know to come here to make suggestions like this.

Developers can use the same concept for this as is available to PC users at no additional impact other than making it noted to users on certain devices if their device is not compatible with the add-ons included on that dedicated server.

I found the new mobile interface annoying at first, but now I like it and would be disappointed if it was reverted.

I don’t experience your problem with the item info obscuring important things, but I also am not using the largest GUI.

There are so many convenient features that the new system has.  You can move stacks between inventory more quickly, even though it takes two taps instead of holding down.  (Items that don’t stack are more tedious to move, but it’s a sacrifice I’m willing to make)  The best aspect is the ability to actually organize chests.  I also love the ability to double tap on a partial stack and have it automatically pull items to complete the stack.

The only aspect of the old system that I miss that I don’t think can be added back is the ability to easily move one item between inventories.

The one thing I would ask that they change is to return the ability to move items from special inventories that only have one slot with only one tap.  Examples would be accepting a villager trade and removing a smelting product from a furnace.
That thing you say about dubble tapping for grabbing a hole stack and so, also were on the old interface, basically it had the same controls, and were smoother, but the new ones are just chunky
To be honest, I hated the old UI, and I don't use touch controls much anymore, anyway. I normally use a controller.
the cosole ui is also trash i started using a keyboard instead but i really prefer the old ui and controller

There should be an option to revert back to the old UI, like there is a classic crafting option (at least on console edition). Everything was organized into categories much better: blocks, decorations, redstone, etc. Now, things are mixed into categories that don’t belong together.
I think the old minecraft interface was better and nostalgic
